section.p: This solution supports two types on Splunk deployment. Firstly, there is a built-in deployment useful for demos and for getting up to speed with Splunk. Alternatively, the solution can be configuired to interact with a standalone production Splunk deployment that you set up independently. In this case, you must explicitly configure the universal forwarders with external "forward servers" (splunk indexers) whereas this happens automatically with the built-in option.

You can enable SSL authentication between the universal forwarders and the indexers in the standalone deployment, by setting the splunk_ssl to yes in the file group_vars/vars. The built-in deployment cannot use SSL and ignores this setting.
The Splunk UI can be reached at htttp://<fqdn>:8000, where <fqdn> is the FQDN of one of your Linux Docker nodes - mesh routing is not working on Windows at this point in time.
